snp1.1:1.1: When anger surges, they drive it out,
snp1.1:1.2: as medicine a snake’s spreading venom.
snp1.1:1.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:1.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:2.2: as if plucking a lotus, flower and stalk.
snp1.1:2.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:2.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:3.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:3.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:4.2: as a great flood, a fragile bridge of reeds.
snp1.1:4.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:4.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:5.1: In future lives they find nothing substantial,
snp1.1:5.2: as one looking among fig trees finds no flower.
snp1.1:5.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:5.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:6.2: gone beyond any kind of existence.
snp1.1:6.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:6.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:7.1: Their mental vibrations are cleared away,
snp1.1:7.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:7.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:8.1: They have not run too far nor run back,
snp1.1:8.2: but have gone beyond all this proliferation.
snp1.1:8.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:8.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:9.1: They have not run too far nor run back,
snp1.1:9.2: for they know that nothing in the world is what it seems.
snp1.1:9.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:9.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:10.1: They have not run too far nor run back,
snp1.1:10.2: knowing nothing is what it seems, free of greed.
snp1.1:10.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:10.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:11.1: They have not run too far nor run back,
snp1.1:11.2: knowing nothing is what it seems, free of lust.
snp1.1:11.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:11.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:12.1: They have not run too far nor run back,
snp1.1:12.2: knowing nothing is what it seems, free of hate.
snp1.1:12.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:12.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:13.1: They have not run too far nor run back,
snp1.1:13.2: knowing nothing is what it seems, free of delusion.
snp1.1:13.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:13.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:14.1: They have no underlying tendencies at all,
snp1.1:14.2: and are rid of unskillful roots,
snp1.1:14.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:14.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:15.1: They have nothing born of distress at all,
snp1.1:15.2: that might cause them to come back to this world.
snp1.1:15.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:15.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:16.1: They have nothing born of entanglement at all,
snp1.1:16.2: that would shackle them to a new life.
snp1.1:16.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:16.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
snp1.1:17.1: They’ve given up the five hindrances,
snp1.1:17.2: untroubled, rid of doubt, free of thorns.
snp1.1:17.3: Such a mendicant sheds this world and the next,
snp1.1:17.4: as a snake its old worn-out skin.
